オプション1: Star Man told Trapezoid Man and the others about the experimental subject he met today.
"Next time I want to give them coconuts as thanks..."
said Square Man.
(Maybe it's okay to bring them here.)
<SCRUNCH SCRUNCH SCRUNCH>
Footsteps came from outside.

Star Man, Triangle Man, and Square Man looked toward the entrance of the ruins.
The experimental subject they'd met at noon was standing there.
In the subject's hand was a knife carved from stone.

The subject said nothing, but their face turned combative.
Gripping the knife in both hands, they charged.
(Damn... I was tricked...!)

Fortunately the subject was only about 120 cm tall,
small enough that he might manage.
<THUD>

Star Man front‑kicked to create distance.
The subject was knocked backward.
"Bring me some kind of weapon!"
Star Man shouted to the kids.
The kids froze and couldn't move.
"Ah."
Square Man pointed at the entrance to the ruins.
Another experimental subject was at the entrance.
The one crawling on the ground was trying to get up.

Star Man was worried about the other subject at the entrance,
but he had to deal with the knife‑wielding one in front of him.
"Drop the knife."
The subject kept coming without stopping, knife in hand.
Star Man front‑kicked again, but the subject grabbed his leg.
The subject raised an arm to stab Star Man's leg with the knife.

Star Man reflexively pulled back his leg; the knife grazed him.
Because it wasn't metal but a handmade knife carved from stone,
the wound wasn't too bad. Blood dripped from his ankle.
Star Man grabbed the subject's arm and tried to wrench the knife away.
The subject clenched the knife to keep it from being taken.
Star Man seized the subject, lifted them, and slammed them to the ground.
<SLAM>

The subject smashed their back against the ground.
Even so, they still held the knife.
Star Man quickly snatched up the knife and leveled it at the subject.

Realizing with a start that he was pointing a blade at a person,
Star Man immediately tossed the knife toward the kids.
"Hold this!"
The kids hurried to pick up the knife.
The subject at the entrance shouted.
"Wait!"
Star Man stepped back.
The one at the entrance walked over and held the other subject close.
"That's enough, okay? Let's go home."
The two subjects pressed shoulder to shoulder and started to leave.
"Wait—explain what's going on."

"I'm not designed to attack people,
but this one is designed to attack people."

"W‑wait—then I can't just let you go like this...
We have an injured person and kids here. And now you know where we live."
The subject averted their eyes and looked down.
The subject hoisted the other onto their back and ran off.
"Uh... what's happening over there...?"

murmured Trapezoid Man.
From where he was, he couldn't see what was happening.
"I can't. My hands are shaking... I can't deliver the finishing blow."
"Maybe we should move."
"You can leave me here. Don't worry about it."
Trapezoid Man had broken both legs and still couldn't walk.
"For a while, I'll stay around the ruins myself."

"If that still doesn't work, we'll move.
Then I'll carry Trapezoid Man on my back."
"Got it."
